pullRequest.body:
The standard additive character of `ZMod N` is a primitive character.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

<details>

</details>
I'll try to have a look. But this week, I'm at a conference and won't have much time.
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by MichaelStollBayreuth.

Very large increase in imports is concerning. 

!bench
Which of the new lemmas need the new import? Can we find a better home for it (or create a new file)?
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/c7469f15-0bb7-40dc-8666-699a91daf46f) for commit 3c2fb6941fbc06b6073aec444969bde9099acd77.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/13723f1e-e677-4bce-bc79-4647f049e7df/to/c7469f15-0bb7-40dc-8666-699a91daf46f) against commit 254c0af36609421f795d162f7269c2b0ecb0c44f.
It is good that regressions are relatively mild but we should avoid importing across top level directories to preserve maintainability. Is this the only way to structure things?

General information: ```text build: +29.732 * 10‚Åπ (+0.0241%) ```
12 files got slower by at least 10‚Åπ instructions ```text Mathlib.Analysis.Fourier.FourierTransformDeriv: +5.0210 * 10‚Åπ (+1.22%) Mathlib.Analysis.Fourier.AddCircle: +3.3039 * 10‚Åπ (+3.84%) Mathlib.Geometry.Euclidean.Angle.Oriented.RightAngle: +2.3576 * 10‚Åπ (+3.69%) Mathlib.Geometry.Euclidean.Angle.Oriented.Rotation: +2.2604 * 10‚Åπ (+3.16%) Mathlib.Geometry.Euclidean.Angle.Sphere: +1.9929 * 10‚Åπ (+4.91%) Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Complex.Circle: +1.7635 * 10‚Åπ (+8.50%) Mathlib.Geometry.Euclidean.Angle.Oriented.Affine: +1.7344 * 10‚Åπ (+2.32%) Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.JacobiTheta.TwoVariable: +1.7102 * 10‚Åπ (+1.92%) Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.PontryaginDual: +1.5761 * 10‚Åπ (+12.9%) Mathlib.Geometry.Euclidean.Triangle: +1.2609 * 10‚Åπ (+2.22%) Mathlib.RepresentationTheory.GroupCohomology.Resolution: +1.2418 * 10‚Åπ (+0.458%) Mathlib.Geometry.Euclidean.Sphere.Ptolemy: +1.0388 * 10‚Åπ (+14.9%) ```
2 files got slower by at least 10%: ```text Mathlib.Geometry.Euclidean.Sphere.Ptolemy: +14.9% Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.PontryaginDual: +12.9% ``` 1 files got faster by at least 10‚Åπ instructions: ```text Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Category.Cat.Limit: -1.1372 * 10‚Åπ (-1.16%) ``` No file got faster by at least 10%.

One could split the file and move everything that talks about `AddChar` to a new file (`AddChar.toCircle_addChar` and everything under "Additive characters valued in the complex circle". The import `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LegendreSymbol.AddCharacter` (rather than just `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.AddChar`) is required only for the very last lemma `ZMod.isPrimitive_stdAddChar`.

Thanks!

bors merge
!bench

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10187027919/job/28180155197)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10187027919/job/28180155433)

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/8698f13c-64d9-4537-96f7-428e73c7b3f3) for commit 59b831eaf36540288107d55fee543943472a8ad4.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/13723f1e-e677-4bce-bc79-4647f049e7df/to/8698f13c-64d9-4537-96f7-428e73c7b3f3) against commit 254c0af36609421f795d162f7269c2b0ecb0c44f.

General information: ```text build: +6.4861 * 10‚Åπ (+0.00526%) ``` 1 file got slower by at least 10‚Åπ instructions: ```text Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.PiTensorProduct.InjectiveSeminorm: +2.1280 * 10‚Åπ (+0.968%) ``` No file got slower by at least 10%. 1 files got faster by at least 10‚Åπ instructions: ```text Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Complex.Circle: -6.2408 * 10‚Åπ (-30.1%) ``` 1 files got faster by at least 10%: ```text Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Complex.Circle: -30.1% ``` (That the file got faster will be caused by the removal of some code from it.)
LGTM!
LGTM!

I think it would make sense to move this, together with the section `Field` above it, to a separate file, in order to reduce the imports for `NumberTheory.LegendreSymbol.AddCharacter` (`import Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.Polynomial` is only needed for these results).

On reflection it probably makes more sense to move `isPrimitive_stdAddChar` to `Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Complex.Circle`, and leave `NumberTheory.LegendreSymbol.AddCharacter` untouched. (We can still split off the results from section `Field` into another file if you want, but that is now orthogonal to this PR.)
OK; let's keep this in mind for later.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LegendreSymbol/AddCharacter): std add char of ZMod N is primitive

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/LSeries): analytic continuation of Dirichlet L-series
[Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis/Fourier/ZMod): more API for discrete Fourier transform
